Context:
* CAPP (Curriculum Advising & Program Planning) is a tool used to evaluate progress against program requirements.
* Evaluations are based on the current program registered in and are not official.
* New evaluations are available throughout the semester, but not during grading and promotions at the end of term.
* New evaluations will be available 10 business days after the end of term.
* Accessible through Stu-View by logging in and selecting "Credential Audit" from the list.
* Not all programs are available for CAPP review, and one must be registered in this term or the last year to access the report.
* CAPP Terminology document can be read for various definitions (accessed through a new window).
* Students are advised to use evaluations as a guide and seek advising for missing requirements as soon as possible.
* For questions about the evaluation, please consult the Academic Department.
* Contact George Brown College at 416-415-2000 or TTY: 1-877-515-5559, or email ask.george@georgebrown.ca.
* Visit the Social Media Hub for more information.
* The information in the website is subject to change without notice and should not be viewed as a representation, offer or warranty. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
